title: Time Machine of the Old City
subTitle: 鐵道與大佛：彰化舊城區時光機械
intro: A journey for railway fans and history lovers. Visit the only operating roundhouse in Taiwan and walk through the living history of Changhua City.

spots.name: Changhua Roundhouse (扇形車庫)
spots.description: Built in 1922, it's a living industrial heritage where steam trains rest. Watch the turntable in action—a true mechanical marvel.

spots.name: Changhua Confucius Temple (彰化孔子廟)
spots.description: A serene Qing Dynasty official building with red walls and green shade, perfect for a quiet afternoon walk.

spots.name: Bagua Mountain Great Buddha (八卦山大佛)
spots.description: Walk the Skywalk at sunset to overlook the Changhua Plain. Visit the Silver Bridge Waterfalls nearby.

title: Lukang: The Open-Air Museum
subTitle: 鹿港風華：穿梭百年的露天博物館
intro: Lukang is the epitome of traditional Minnan culture. Explore the winding alleys and temples of what was once Taiwan's second-largest city.
transportation: **Taiwan Tourist Shuttle 6936** from Taichung HSR or Changhua Station.

spots.name: Lukang Longshan Temple (鹿港龍山寺)
spots.description: Known as the 'Forbidden City of Taiwan'. Admire the exquisite wooden spider web ceiling (zaojing) over the theater stage.

spots.name: Nine Turns Lane (九曲巷)
spots.description: Experience the wisdom of ancestors. The curved alleys were designed to break the strong northeast monsoon winds.

spots.name: Lukang Tianhou Temple (鹿港天后宮)
spots.description: Worship the Meizhou Mazu. The temple is always bustling with incense and devotees. Try the Oyster Omelet nearby.

title: Tale of Two Cities
subTitle: 雙城記：彰化市歷史x鹿港工藝
intro: The classic route connecting the two cores of Northern Changhua. From the railway heritage of the city to the craftsmanship of the port town.

spots.name: Nanyao Temple (南瑤宮)
spots.description: A Mazu temple with a twist. The Guanyin Hall features Baroque architecture with Greek columns and Japanese dormer windows.

spots.name: Bagua Mountain Skywalk (八卦山天空步道)
spots.description: Walk among the tree canopy and enjoy the night view of Changhua City. Finish the night with a bowl of Braised Pork Rice.

spots.name: Lukang Artist Village (桂花巷藝術村)
spots.description: Interact with resident artists. Try DIY lion heads or lanterns in this revitalized Japanese dormitory area.

title: Flowers & Glass Fantasy
subTitle: 海陸雙拼：田尾花園x玻璃幻境
intro: A mix of soft floral landscapes and hard industrial beauty. Visit the flower capital of Tianwei and the unique Glass Temple by the sea.

spots.name: Tianwei Highway Garden (田尾公路花園)
spots.description: Rent a quadricycle to roam the flower fields. In season, witness the 'Electric Chrysanthemum' night view.

spots.name: Cheng Mei Cultural Park (成美文化園)
spots.description: Known as the 'Kenrokuen of Taiwan'. A stunning garden featuring century-old black pines and a restored Hakka mansion.

spots.name: Glass Mazu Temple (玻璃媽祖廟)
spots.description: The only glass temple in the world. Wait for the lights to turn on after sunset for a breathtaking reflection photo.

title: Changhua Grand Traverse
subTitle: 全境精華：山海線大縱走
intro: A complete pilgrimage covering the North, West, and South. From the ancient capital to the flower country, experience the full spectrum of Changhua.

spots.name: Lukang Old Street (鹿港老街)
spots.description: Stay overnight in a renovated old house B&B to experience the quiet morning atmosphere of the historic town.

spots.name: Yuanlin City Food (員林美食)
spots.description: Yuanlin has a refined food culture. Try the Rice Moss Noodles (Mi-Tai-Mu) and Chicken Feet Jelly.

spots.name: Changhua Meat Ba-wan (彰化肉圓)
spots.description: End your trip with the iconic fried meat dumpling. A must-eat culinary symbol of Changhua.

title: Forest Breath & Old Railways
subTitle: 森呼吸與鐵道：二水跑水x八卦山
intro: Avoid the crowds and focus on nature. Hike the Bagua Mountain trails and explore the rural charm of the Jiji Line railway starting point.

spots.name: Ershui Old Street (二水老街)
spots.description: The starting point of the Jiji Line. Visit the Steam Train Display Field and learn about the Babbau Canal irrigation history.

spots.name: Tianzhong Forest Park (田中森林公園)
spots.description: Hike the trail for a panoramic view of the Changhua Plain. Tianzhong is also known as the hometown of socks.
